data.name: Languages
data.description: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.
data.snippet: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language.

data.name: Ability Score Increase
data.description: Your ability scores each increase by 1.

data.name: Age
data.description: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

data.name: Alignment
data.description: Humans tend toward no particular alignment. The best and the worst are found among them.

data.name: Size
data.description: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

data.name: Speed
data.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

data.name: Darkvision
data.description: Thanks to your orc blood, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
data.snippet: You can see in darkness (shades of gray) up to 60 ft.

data.name: Menacing
data.description: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.
data.snippet: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

data.name: Relentless Endurance
data.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.
data.snippet: When you are reduced to 0 HP but not killed, you can drop to 1 HP instead once per long rest.

data.name: Savage Attacks
data.description: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon’s damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.
data.snippet: When you score a critical hit, roll one of the weapon’s dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage.

data.name: Ability Score Increase
data.description: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.

data.name: Languages
data.description: You can speak, read, and write Common and Orc. Orc is a harsh, grating language with hard consonants. It has no script of its own but is written in the Dwarvish script.

data.name: Age
data.description: Half-orcs mature a little faster than humans, reaching adulthood around age 14. They age noticeably faster and rarely live longer than 75 years.

data.name: Alignment
data.description: Half-orcs inherit a tendency toward chaos from their orc parents and are not strongly inclined toward good. Half-orcs raised among orcs and willing to live out their lives among them are usually evil.

data.name: Size
data.description: Half-orcs are somewhat larger and bulkier than humans, and they range from 5 to well over 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

data.name: Speed
data.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

data.name: Draconic Ancestry
data.description:
You have draconic ancestry. Choose one type of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. Your breath weapon and damage resistance are determined by the dragon type, as shown in the table.
Draconic Ancestry




Dragon
Damage Type
Breath Weapon




Black
Acid
5 by 30 ft. line (Dex. save)

5 by 30 ft. line (Dex. save)

data.snippet: You gain a breath weapon and damage resistance with your chosen dragon type.

data.name: Breath Weapon
data.description: You can use your action to exhale destructive energy. Your draconic ancestry determines the size, shape, and damage type of the exhalation. When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes 2d6 damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level. After you use your breath weapon, you can’t use it again until you complete a short or long rest.
data.snippet: Once per short rest as an action, exhale destructive energy based on your Draconic Ancestry. Each creature in the area must make a DC {{savedc:con}} saving throw (type determined by your ancestry), taking 2d6 ([6th] 3d6, [11th] 4d6, [16th] 5d6) on a failed save, and half damage on a successful one.

data.name: Damage Resistance
data.description: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.
data.snippet: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.

data.name: Ability Score Increase
data.description: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.

data.name: Languages
data.description: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

data.name: Age
data.description: Young dragonborn grow quickly. They walk hours after hatching, attain the size and development of a 10-year-old human child by the age of 3, and reach adulthood by 15. They live to be around 80.

data.name: Alignment
data.description: Dragonborn tend to extremes, making a conscious choice for one side or the other in the cosmic war between good and evil (represented by Bahamut and Tiamat, respectively). Most dragonborn are good, but those who side with Tiamat can be terrible villains.
Dragonborn are taller and heavier than humans, standing well over 6 feet tall and averaging almost 250 pounds. Your size is Medium.
data.name: Size
Speed
data.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

data.name: Darkvision
data.description: Thanks to your infernal heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
data.snippet: You can see in darkness (shades of gray) up to 60 ft.

data.name: Hellish Resistance
data.description: You have resistance to fire damage.
data.snippet: You have resistance to fire damage.

data.name: Infernal Legacy
data.description: You know the thaumaturgy cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the hellish rebuke spell as a 2nd-level spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the darkness spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
data.snippet: You know the thaumaturgy cantrip. [3rd] You can cast hellish rebuke (2nd) once per long rest. [5th] You can cast darkness once per long rest. CHA is your spellcasting ability.

data.name: Ability Score Increase
data.description: Your Intelligence score increases by 1, and your Charisma score increases by 2.

data.name: Languages
data.description: You can speak, read, and write Common and Infernal.

data.name: Age
data.description: Tieflings mature at the same rate as humans but live a few years longer.

data.name: Alignment
data.description: Tieflings might not have an innate tendency toward evil, but many of them end up there. Evil or not, an independent nature inclines many tieflings toward a chaotic alignment.
Tieflings are about the same size and build as humans. Your size is Medium.
data.name: Size
Speed
data.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

data.name: Darkvision
data.description: Thanks to your elf blood, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
data.snippet: You can see in darkness (shades of gray) up to 60 ft.

data.name: Fey Ancestry
data.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put you to sleep.
data.snippet: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put you to sleep.

data.name: Skill Versatility
data.description: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
data.snippet: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

data.name: Ability Score Increase
data.description: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and two other ability scores of your choice increase by 1.

data.name: Languages
data.description: You can speak, read, and write Common, Elvish, and one extra language of your choice.

data.name: Age
data.description: Half-elves mature at the same rate humans do and reach adulthood around the age of 20. They live much longer than humans, however, often exceeding 180 years.

data.name: Alignment
data.description: Half-elves share the chaotic bent of their elven heritage. They value both personal freedom and creative expression, demonstrating neither love of leaders nor desire for followers. They chafe at rules, resent others’ demands, and sometimes prove unreliable, or at least unpredictable.
Half-elves are about the same size as humans, ranging from 5 to 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.
data.name: Size
Speed
data.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

data.name: Darkvision
data.description: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
data.snippet: You can see in darkness (shades of gray) up to 60 ft.

data.name: Dwarven Resilience
data.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage (explained in the “Combat” section).
data.snippet: You have advantage on saves against poison and resistance against poison damage.

data.name: Dwarven Combat Training
data.description: You have proficiency with the battleaxe, handaxe, light hammer, and warhammer.
data.snippet: You have proficiency with the battleaxe, handaxe, light hammer, and warhammer.

data.name: Tool Proficiency
data.description: You gain proficiency with the artisan’s tools of your choice: smith’s tools, brewer’s supplies, or mason’s tools.
data.snippet: You gain proficiency with your choice of smith’s tools, brewer’s supplies, or mason’s tools.

data.name: Stonecunning
data.description: Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.
data.snippet: Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check.

data.name: Ability Score Increase
data.description: Your Constitution score increases by 2.

data.name: Languages
data.description: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish. Dwarvish is full of hard consonants and guttural sounds, and those characteristics spill over into whatever other language a dwarf might speak.

data.name: Age
data.description: Dwarves mature at the same rate as humans, but they’re considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

data.name: Alignment
data.description: Most dwarves are lawful, believing firmly in the benefits of a well-ordered society. They tend toward good as well, with a strong sense of fair play and a belief that everyone deserves to share in the benefits of a just order.
Dwarves stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and average about 150 pounds. Your size is Medium.
data.name: Size
Speed
data.description: Your base walking speed is 25 feet. Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.

data.name: Ability Score Increase
data.description: Your Wisdom score increases by 1.

data.name: Dwarven Toughness
data.description: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.
data.snippet: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

data.name: Ability Score Increase
data.description: Your Strength score increases by 2.

data.name: Dwarven Armor Training
data.description: You have proficiency with light and medium armor.
data.snippet: You have proficiency with light and medium armor.

data.name: Lucky
data.description: When you roll a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.
data.snippet: When you roll a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

data.name: Brave
data.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
data.snippet: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

data.name: Halfling Nimbleness
data.description: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.
data.snippet: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

data.name: Ability Score Increase
data.description: Your Dexterity score increases by 2.

data.name: Languages
data.description: You can speak, read, and write Common and Halfling. The Halfling language isn’t secret, but halflings are loath to share it with others. They write very little, so they don’t have a rich body of literature. Their oral tradition, however, is very strong. Almost all halflings speak Common to converse with the people in whose lands they dwell or through which they are traveling.

data.name: Age
data.description: A halfling reaches adulthood at the age of 20 and generally lives into the middle of his or her second century.

data.name: Alignment
data.description: Most halflings are lawful good. As a rule, they are good-hearted and kind, hate to see others in pain, and have no tolerance for oppression. They are also very orderly and traditional, leaning heavily on the support of their community and the comfort of their old ways.
Halflings average about 3 feet tall and weigh about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

data.name: Speed
data.description: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

data.name: Naturally Stealthy
data.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.
data.snippet: You can attempt to hide even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

data.name: Ability Score Increase
data.description: Your Charisma score increases by 1.

data.name: Stout Resilience
data.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.
data.snippet: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

data.name: Ability Score Increase
data.description: Your Constitution score increases by 1.

data.name: Darkvision
data.description: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
data.snippet: You can see in darkness (shades of gray) up to 60 ft.

data.name: Gnome Cunning
data.description: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.
data.snippet: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

data.name: Ability Score Increase
data.description: Your Intelligence score increases by 2.

data.name: Languages
data.description: You can speak, read, and write Common and Gnomish. The Gnomish language, which uses the Dwarvish script, is renowned for its technical treatises and its catalogs of knowledge about the natural world.

data.name: Age
data.description: Gnomes mature at the same rate humans do, and most are expected to settle down into an adult life by around age 40. They can live 350 to almost 500 years.

data.name: Alignment
data.description: Gnomes are most often good. Those who tend toward law are sages, engineers, researchers, scholars, investigators, or inventors. Those who tend toward chaos are minstrels, tricksters, wanderers, or fanciful jewelers. Gnomes are good-hearted, and even the tricksters among them are more playful than vicious.
Gnomes are between 3 and 4 feet tall and average about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

data.name: Speed
data.description: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

data.name: Artificer’s Lore
data.description: Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices, you can add twice your proficiency bonus, instead of any proficiency bonus you normally apply.
data.snippet: Add twice your proficiency bonus to History checks related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices.

data.name: Tinker
data.description:
You have proficiency with artisan’s tools (tinker’s tools). Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time.
When you create a device, choose one of the following options:
Clockwork Toy. This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of your turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.
Fire Starter. The device produces a miniature flame, which you can use to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires your action.
Music Box. When opened, this music box plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song’s end or when it is closed.
data.snippet: You are proficient with tinker's tools and can use them to construct tiny clockwork devices.

data.name: Ability Score Increase
data.description: Your Constitution score increases by 1.

data.name: Darkvision
data.description: Accustomed to twilit forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
data.snippet: You can see in darkness (shades of gray) up to 60 ft.

data.name: Keen Senses
data.description: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.
data.snippet: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

data.name: Fey Ancestry
data.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put you to sleep.
data.snippet: You have advantage on saves against being charmed, and magic can’t put you to sleep.

data.name: Trance
data.description: Elves don’t need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is “trance.”) While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.
data.snippet: You don't need to sleep, but meditate semiconsciously for 4 hours a day. While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

data.name: Ability Score Increase
data.description: Your Dexterity score increases by 2.

data.name: Languages
data.description: You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish. Elvish is fluid, with subtle intonations and intricate grammar. Elven literature is rich and varied, and their songs and poems are famous among other races. Many bards learn their language so they can add Elvish ballads to their repertoires.

data.name: Age
data.description: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood and an adult name around the age of 100 and can live to be 750 years old.

data.name: Alignment
data.description: Elves love freedom, variety, and self-expression, so they lean strongly toward the gentler aspects of chaos. They value and protect others’ freedom as well as their own, and they are more often good than not. The drow are an exception; their exile into the Underdark has made them vicious and dangerous. Drow are more often evil than not.
Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

data.name: Speed
data.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

data.name: Elf Weapon Training
data.description: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.
data.snippet: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

data.name: Cantrip
data.description: You know one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.
data.snippet: You know one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list. INT is your spellcasting ability for it.

data.name: Extra Language
data.description: You can speak, read, and write one extra language of your choice.
data.snippet: You can speak, read, and write one extra language of your choice.

data.name: Ability Score Increase
data.description: Your Intelligence score increases by 1.

data.name: Elf Weapon Training
data.description: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.
data.snippet: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

data.name: Fleet of Foot
data.description: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.
data.snippet: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

data.name: Mask of the Wild
data.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.
data.snippet: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured.

data.name: Ability Score Increase
data.description: Your Wisdom score increases by 1.

data.name: Superior Darkvision
data.description: Your darkvision has a radius of 120 feet.
data.snippet: Your darkvision has a radius of 120 feet.

data.name: Stone Camouflage
data.description: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in rocky terrain.
data.snippet: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in rocky terrain.

data.name: Ability Score Increase
data.description: Your Dexterity score increases by 1.

data.name: Languages
data.description: You can speak, read, and write Common, Gnomish, and Undercommon. The svirfneblin dialect is more guttural than surface Gnomish, and most svirfneblin know only a little bit of Common, but those who deal with outsiders (and that includes you as an adventurer) pick up enough Common to get by in other lands.

data.name: Age
data.description: Deep gnomes are short-lived for gnomes. They mature at the same rate humans do and are considered full-grown adults by 25. They live 200 to 250 years, although hard toil and the dangers of the Underdark often claim them before their time.

data.name: Alignment
data.description: Svirfneblin believe that survival depends on avoiding entanglements with other creatures and not making enemies, so they favor neutral alignments. They rarely wish others ill, and they are unlikely to take risks on behalf of others.
A typical svirfneblin stands about 3 to 3½ feet tall and weighs 80 to 120 pounds. Your size is Small.
